meanings.definition: A plural noun meaning a group of people or things regarded as the best or most desirable in a particular society or category.
meanings.sent1: In the fashion world, the elite are the top models who walk the runways.
meanings.sent2: The elite athletes trained hard to win the championship.
meanings.sent3: At the party, everyone wanted to be part of the elite group near the VIP section.
meanings.sent4: The elite of the business world always seem to know the best strategies.
meanings.sent5: Being part of the elite requires dedication and hard work.

meanings.definition: A verb meaning to make something less heavy or to reduce in weight.
meanings.sent1: To lites the load, we removed unnecessary items from the backpack.
meanings.sent2: The movers had to lites the furniture to carry it up the stairs.
meanings.sent3: Trying to lites the elephant by lifting it was a comical sight.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she could lites the burden of responsibility by sharing it with her team.
meanings.sent5: The magician seemed to lites the heavy box with just a wave of his hand.

meanings.definition: An adjective meaning having a low fat or low calorie content.
meanings.sent1: The lites salad dressing is perfect for those watching their calories.
meanings.sent2: She chose the lites version of the snack for a healthier option.
meanings.sent3: The lites dessert tasted surprisingly delicious despite being low in calories.
meanings.sent4: The lites menu at the restaurant offered guilt-free dining options.
meanings.sent5: The lites yogurt was a refreshing treat on a hot day.
